results.title: A different perspective
results.brief_description: ‘I was given a photo pass to the 1994 Big Day Out. From then on, outside my day job I worked as a freelance photographer’. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’.

results.title: Cardin Street
results.brief_description: A little piece of wood tells a whole story about a house, about home, about friendship. A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop Telling Tales. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for Telling Tales.
results.description: A little piece of wood tells a whole story about a house, about home, about friendship. results.title: From the heart
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Hossein Valamanesh
results.brief_description: Using 35mm footage capturing his own angiogram, Hossein Valamanesh creates a mysterious, luminescent universe which hovers, like a heartbeat, between biology and the sublime.
results.description: Using 35mm footage capturing his own angiogram, Hossein Valamanesh creates a mysterious, luminescent universe which hovers, like a heartbeat, between biology and the sublime.

results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Arlene TextaQueen

results.title: Blood disco: Dirk wears white socks
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Scott Redford
results.brief_description: Scott Redford’s visually rampant fist-in-mouth and Egyptian eye images riff on the early surrealist films of Luis Buñuel, via a queer punk aesthetic, in this pop-savvy work.
results.description: Scott Redford’s visually rampant fist-in-mouth and Egyptian eye images riff on the early surrealist films of Luis Buñuel, via a queer punk aesthetic, in this pop-savvy work.

results.title: Vessel
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Simryn Gill
results.brief_description: Simryn Gill’s languid mini-series stills the television screen, her camera framing a simple fishing boat and its passage, in real time, across the horizon.
results.description: Simryn Gill’s languid mini-series stills the television screen, her camera framing a simple fishing boat and its passage, in real time, across the horizon.

results.title: Train No. 6
results.creator_credit: ACMI, SBS Independent and Daniel Crooks
results.brief_description: Using Melbourne’s urban landscape, ‘Train No.6’ extends Crooks’ exploration of his ‘TimeSlice’ technique. A simple train is reconfigured across time to form mesmerising polyocular images.
results.description: Using Melbourne’s urban landscape, ‘Train No.6’ extends Crooks’ exploration of his ‘TimeSlice’ technique. A simple train is reconfigured across time to form mesmerising polyocular images.

results.title: Peg: a life to remember
results.brief_description: Peg and Bryan have been trekking all over the world since 1987. Bryan recalls their travels and the great times spent with his wife, who now has Alzheimer’s disease. Created as part of ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ in association with Vic Health and the Alzheimer’s Association.
results.description: Peg and Bryan have been trekking all over the world since 1987. Bryan recalls their travels and the great times spent with his wife, who now has Alzheimer’s disease. Created as part of ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ in association with Vic Health and the Alzheimer’s Association.

results.title: Keith's story
results.brief_description: Although now struggling with Alzheimer’s disease, the stories of Keith’s achievements and adventures as told by his wife are a tribute to his inspirational life. Created as part of ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ in association with Vic Health and the Alzheimer’s Association.

results.title: A Letter for Marie
results.brief_description: South African born Marie has been diagnosed with Alzheimer’s disease. Her husband, Tom, speaks of their 33-years together and of the good times still to come. Created as part of ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ in association with Vic Health and the Alzheimer’s Association.
results.description: South African born Marie has been diagnosed with Alzheimer’s disease. Her husband, Tom, speaks of their 33-years together and of the good times still to come. Created as part of ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ in association with Vic Health and the Alzheimer’s Association.
